intro: Koeleria laxa, commonly known as the slender wild oat, is a flowering plant native to the colder regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spikelet-based flowers that are typically green or brown in color. Koeleria laxa is often found in alpine and arctic environments, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Its low-growing form and ability to withstand harsh climates make it an important component of tundra and subarctic ecosystems.
